title: Post-bariatric hypoglycemia episode documentation
text: 35F, 8 months post-Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, presenting with recurrent hypoglycemic episodes. Symptoms include diaphoresis, tremor, tachycardia, and neuroglycopenic symptoms including confusion and visual disturbances. Episodes occur 90-120 minutes postprandial. Continuous glucose monitoring demonstrates glucose nadirs of 45-55 mg/dL. Currently on acarbose 50mg TID with partial symptom control. No prior history of diabetes mellitus. BMI pre-surgery 42, current BMI 28. Seeking additional treatment recommendations.
